message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.RO, cs.SY

The paper proposes a new method to study the internal memory used by reinforcement learning policies, which is a topic closely related to machine learning and artificial intelligence. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves estimating mutual information and memory capacity, which are concepts related to neural networks and computational neuroscience, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also discusses the use of memory in the context of robotics and control, which could place it in the cs.RO (Robotics) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on understanding and improving reinforcement learning algorithms could also place it in the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
